official-title.#text: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 59) making continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2014, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules; providing for proceedings during the period from December 14, 2013, through January 6, 2014; and for other purposes.

committee-name.#tail: , reported the following resolution; which was referred to the House Calendar and ordered to be printed

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: table the joint resolution (
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) making continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2014, and for other purposes, with the House amendment to the Senate amendment thereto, and to consider in the House, without intervention of any point of order, a motion offered by the chair of the
or his designee that the House recede from its amendment and concur in the Senate amendment with the amendment printed in part A of the report of the

accompanying this resolution modified by the amendment printed in part B of that report. The Senate amendment and the motion shall be considered as read. The motion shall be debatable for 70 minutes, with 60 minutes equally divided and controlled by the chair and ranking minority member of the
and 10 minutes equally divided and controlled by the chair and ranking minority member of the
. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the motion to its adoption without intervening motion or demand for division of the question.

, the Clerk may conform division, title, and section numbers and conform cross-references and provisions for short titles.

to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules as though under clause 1 of rule XV. The

text.#text: It shall be in order at any time on the legislative day of December 12, 2013, or December 13, 2013, for the
On any legislative day of the first session of the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress after December 13, 2013—
the Journal of the proceedings of the previous day shall be considered as approved; and

the Chair may at any time declare the House adjourned to meet at a date and time, within the limits of clause 4, section 5, article I of the Constitution, to be announced by the Chair in declaring the adjournment.
On any legislative day of the second session of the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress before January 7, 2014—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may dispense with organizational and legislative business;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

text.#text: the Journal of the proceedings of the previous day shall be considered as approved if applicable; and

the Chair at any time may declare the House adjourned to meet at a date and time, within the limits of clause 4, section 5, article I of the Constitution, to be announced by the Chair in declaring the adjournment.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may appoint Members to perform the duties of the Chair for the duration of the period addressed by sections 6 and 7 as though under clause 8(a) of rule I.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

text.#text: Each day during the period addressed by sections 6 and 7 of this resolution shall not constitute a calendar day for purposes of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 7 of the War Powers Resolution

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) to provide a temporary extension of the

and amendments made by that Act, as previously extended and amended and with certain additional modifications and exceptions, to suspend permanent price support authorities, and for other purposes. All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived. The amendment printed in part C of the report of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: accompanying this resolution shall be considered as adopted. The bill, as amended, shall be considered as read. All points of order against provisions in the bill, as amended, are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the bill, as amended, and on any amendment thereto to final passage without intervening motion except: (1) 40 minutes of debate equally divided and controlled by the chair and ranking minority member of the
; and (2) one motion to recommit with or without instructions.
